SCSK puts it all in one place.

5:30pm on a Friday.

Boss wants a progress report.
Client wants photos.
You can't remember what you did Monday.

Sound familiar?

SCSK tracks everything as you go. Reports take 30 seconds.

Which site was that defect at?
When was it taken?

Good luck finding anything.

SCSK organizes photos by project automatically.

"Just use the app!"
"There's no reception on site."
"Oh."

Every. Single. Time.

SCSK works offline. Syncs when you're back in range.

Built for real sites, not office demos.

"Did you document that?"
"I meant to..."

We've all been there.

SCSK makes logging so fast you'll actually do it.

Quick notes. Quick photos. Quick job updates.

Who was that sparky's name again?

*scrolls through 200 contacts*
*checks old texts*
*gives up*

SCSK keeps all your site contacts organized by trade and project.

Find anyone in 2 seconds.

Sunday night.

You're writing progress reports instead of watching the footy.

Again.

SCSK generates reports from data you've already logged. Takes seconds.

Get your weekends back.

Running 3 sites at once?

Which materials are where?
Which trades are on which job?
What's the status of each?

Your brain shouldn't be the database.

SCSK keeps it all straight.

Client: "Can you send me all photos from last month?"

You: *internally screaming*

With SCSK: Filter by date. Export. Send. Done.

2 minutes vs 2 hours.

End of project. Time to find that ONE photo from week 2.

Good luck scrolling through 2,000 images.

Or... use SCSK and search by date, project, or tag.

"I wrote it down somewhere..."

Famous last words on every construction site.

SCSK: Everything searchable. Everything backed up. Nothing lost.

How much time do you spend LOOKING for information vs USING it?

SCSK cuts search time to zero.

Everything organized. Everything findable.

The apprentice deleted all the photos.

Again.

SCSK backs up automatically. Nothing gets "accidentally" deleted.

"Let me check my emails... and texts... and that folder..."

Or just search SCSK.

Monday morning. New week. New chaos.

Or... open SCSK and see exactly where everything stands.

Start organized. Stay organized.

How many group chats are you in for work?

Important info buried under memes and arguments.

SCSK: One place. Everything searchable.

"I'll remember that."

No you won't.

Log it in SCSK. 5 seconds. Done.

Your phone dies.

All your site notes? Gone.
All your photos? Gone.
All your contacts? Gone.

Unless you use SCSK. Cloud backup. Always.

Defect claim comes in 6 months later.

"Prove you did it right."

With SCSK: Here's the dated photos, notes, and sign-offs.

Without: Good luck.

I'm a site foreman who got tired of bad software.

Apps that don't work offline.
Spreadsheets everywhere.
Paper that gets destroyed.

So I learned to code and built what I needed.

SCSK isn't designed by a tech company. It's designed by someone who uses it.

SCSK is built by one person.

No VC funding.
No corporate roadmap.
No committee decisions.

Just one foreman building tools for other tradies.

Your feedback goes directly to me.

15 years on construction sites taught me one thing:

The tools we have suck.

So I built better ones.

SCSK is what happens when a tradie learns to code.

Every week I push a new SCSK update.

Bug fixes. New features. Performance improvements.

No waiting 6 months for the next version.

SCSK is built in Australia ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡º

For Aussie tradies first.

I use SCSK every day on my own jobs.

If something annoys me, I fix it that week.

That's the advantage of using your own product.

No investors. No board meetings. No corporate BS.

Just me, building what tradies actually need.

SCSK is independent and staying that way.

I reply to every email personally.

No support tickets.
No chatbots.
No waiting.

Just direct communication.

admin@sc-sk.com

Why am I building SCSK?

Because I needed it.
Because my mates needed it.
Because every tradie deserves better tools.

Simple as that.

Started as a spreadsheet I made for myself.

Now it's an app helping tradies across Australia.

Funny how that works.

Construction tip:

Document BEFORE you cover it up.

â€¢ Waterproofing â†’ photo
â€¢ Framing â†’ photo
â€¢ Services â†’ photo

You'll thank yourself during defect claims.

(SCSK makes this easy)

Site organization tip:

End every day with a 2-minute brain dump.

What happened. What's next. What's blocked.

Future you will appreciate it.

Site photo tip:

Always include something for scale.

A tape measure. Your boot. A pen.

Photos without scale are useless in disputes.

Client communication tip:

Send progress photos weekly, even if they don't ask.

Builds trust.
Prevents surprises.
Looks professional.

Quoting tip:

Track actual vs estimated on every job.

After 10 jobs, you'll know exactly where you under-quote.

SCSK helps track this.

Weather tip:

Check the 3-day forecast before scheduling outdoor work.

Obvious? Yes.
How many people do it? Not enough.

SCSK shows weather on dashboard.

Networking tip:

Save every tradie's contact with their trade.

"Dave - Sparky"
"Mike - Plumber"

Or just use SCSK's contact manager.

Data tip:

Your phone could die tomorrow.

Are your site photos backed up?
Are your notes saved somewhere?

SCSK syncs automatically.

Efficiency tip:

Batch your admin.

Don't do it throughout the day.
Set 15 minutes at end of day.

Or use SCSK and log as you go.

Handover tip:

The next person doesn't know what you know.

Document like you're leaving tomorrow.

SCSK makes this automatic.

Defect prevention tip:

Photo everything before it gets covered.

Waterproofing. Framing. Services.

SCSK timestamps and organizes automatically.

Site meeting tip:

Take a quick note after every site meeting.

Who said what. What was agreed.

2 minutes now saves 2 hours later.

Material tip:

Log deliveries when they arrive, not "later."

Later never comes.

SCSK: 5 second log entry.

End of week tip:

Spend 5 minutes reviewing what got done.

It's more than you think.

SCSK shows you automatically.

Morning tip:

Check your job status before leaving home.

Know what you're walking into.

SCSK dashboard: 10 second overview.
